question: A 26-year-old male presents with the complaint of a smooth and globular swelling in the left upper part of his neck for the past 5 years without any significant increase in size. There is no history of associated fever or weight loss. What is the most likely diagnosis?

A patient comes to the outpatient department with a history of squamous cell carcinoma of the oral cavity. Lymph nodes in the cervical region are palpable. He undergoes resection of the tumor along with primary neck dissection. Which of the following structures are preserved in a radical neck dissection?

answers.option: Sternocleidomastoid muscle and spinal accessory nerve
Submandibular gland, internal jugular vein, and tail of parotid gland
Phrenic nerve, hypoglossal nerve, and carotid artery
All lymph nodes in levels I to V, sternocleidomastoid muscle, and submandibular gland
Internal jugular vein, sternocleidomastoid muscle, and spinal accessory nerve

question: A 12-year-old boy is diagnosed with a thyroglossal duct cyst. Which of the following procedures would be the most appropriate to address his problem?
Following neck dissection, a patient complains of difficulty in raising his arm above shoulder level. What is this known as?

A 31-year-old female presented in the outpatient department (OPD) with the complaint of swelling in the upper part of the neck below the jaw, which becomes painful and increases in size while talking. What is the diagnosis?

A 20-year-old boy is complaining of severe sore throat and fever and also difficulty in swallowing for one week. His family physician gave him oral amoxiclave, but his condition further deteriorated. Neck examination revealed bilaterally enlarged and tender lymph nodes. He is also complaining of upper abdominal discomfort. What is the most likely organism that can cause this condition?
What is the most common congenital neck cyst?

A 31-year-old female presented in the outpatient department (OPD) with the complaint of swelling in the upper part of the neck below the jaw, which becomes painful and increases in size while taking a meal. What is the diagnosis?
